an5.100:2.2: BB doesn’t translate -gata. But I take it in the same sense as ditthigata, meaning “fixed, rigid, stuck”. BB has “involvement” for gata at AN 7.54, which feels too weak. In bacon and eggs, gata is the pig, not the chicken!
an5.100:2.4: See BB’s note for the context of “that”.
an5.100:5.7: I add the name here, as I was genuinely confused about who the “moghapurisa” was. Maybe I’m just dumb!
an5.100:6.9: On tuma see BB’s note, also CPD for ātuma.
